results.title: Artistic expression
results.creator_credit: Sandra Ostertag, CBS, Coast Community Colleges, Holt, Rinehart and Winston and KOCE-TV (Television station : Huntington Beach, Calif.)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 18 of Series “The Photographic vision”.
Overviews the artisitic expression of two innovative photographers, Nathan Lyons and Susan Rankaitis. The curator of the George Eastman House discusses the highly individualistic images produced by these photographers.

results.title: Artisans of Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: This video is an intimate view of traditional building and restoration techniques through the eyes of master craftsmen and women. It reveals rare skills which are fast disappearing in this rapidly changing world. The film has six sections each examining an individual craft: timbercraft, stonecraft, glasscraft, ironcraft, solid plastering and decorative paint work.

results.title: Artimus and old laces
results.brief_description: An important concept, the distributive principle, is illustrated in this animated tale about the multiplication problems of Cyrus Squeeze, tax collector. His niece Louise helps out by picturing each problem as areas or rectangular arrays, which she then adds up for the final product. No other credits available.

results.title: Arthur C Clarke presents the colours of infinity
results.creator_credit: Nigel Lesmoir-Gordon, Paul Sinclair and Gordon Films
results.brief_description: The subject of this video is the recent discovery in New York by Dr Benoit Mandelbrot of the Mandelbrot Set. This discovery led to the development of a new mathematical discipline- fractal geometry. Mandelbrot’s discovery was aided by the development of the silicon chip in the 1970’s. It was in the 1980’s, assisted by a super computer at IBN laboratories in New York that Mandelbrot’s startling discovery was made. Author and inventor Dr Arthur C Clarke explores the Mandelbrot Set and fractal world along with fellow colleagues Dr Benoit Mandelbrot, Professor Stephen Hawking, Dr Michael Barnsley and Professor Ian Stewart. Clarke (who wrote the script) postulates on the effect these discoveries will have on the future.

constellations_other.name: Location and exploration
constellations_other.description: A comparative look at location-based gaming and street art and how the way we experience these two art forms has moved out of traditional spaces and onto the street.

results.title: Art, people, feelings
results.creator_credit: Paul Burnford, Paul Burnford Film Productions and Pyramid Films
results.brief_description: The relationship between human emotions and the art created is illustrated by a selection of artistic works which span all periods of history and a variety of subjects. Shows ways in which artists use many materials and methods to translate their personal feelings into visual forms: murals, landscapes, portraits, posters, billboards, abstract paintings, cartoons, pop art, sculpture and motion pictures. Suitable for secondary level years 7-12.
